data.title: A little overpriced for lunch
data.text: I went here for lunch with a colleague and I was surprised at how high the prices were for lunch. The food was good and the service was so so.

data.title: Surprising Gem!
data.text: I went to Cilantro this past weekend with my family and really enjoyed my meal.  To start off they have happy hour appetizers, 5 pm to 7 pm, where there dinner menu appetizer items are priced at $5.00.  We had the chicken quesadilla (different than Mexican version) and their guacamole.  Some of the menu prices were over $10 for the same dish.  My two adult kids had steaks that perfectly cooked and tasty.  The restaurant bills itself as latin fusion and all of the dishes were quite good.  I had the chicken dish, pollo relleno which was suggested by the waitress, it was good but not as strong as the steak cubano or the steak gaucho.  Entrees at $20 to $22 are not cheap, but at least the food and service were superior.  I'm going back.

data.title: Incredible food- so so service
data.text: I ordered the red snapper with fava beans and mushroom risotto.  Each part was delectable and could have been a satisfying dish in itself.  Put all together, you have an interesting sampler.  For a vegetarian, there are no entree choices for dinner.  However, ordering 3 sides, including doubly fried plantains with salsa, spinach, rice/beans is enough and well done for one's dinner.  I found the food to be the best I've found in Stamford.  I found the service to be haphazard.  Multiple people who came after us were able to order first, and served before us.  For that, I took away a star.

data.title: Delicious Food - Staff a little overwhelmed.
data.text:
If i were just reviewing the food this evening I would give it a solid 5.  The 4 of us each tried something different and each was as good as the others.  The balance of spices in each dish (we are big on tasting each others :) were honestly the best I have had around in terms of Latin Food.  Certainly better than another, not to be named celebrity owned restaurant in town

In addition to our entrees we had two appetizers and guacamole which was a lot of food. (she warned us not to get an appetizer each because they were large portions)  The Duo Empanadas and the Costarican Enyucada - both shared by my sons and husband and they said they were delicious.

For entrees we had between us the Pollo Relleno (delicious with a cilantro Tequila honey sauce that was amazing) The Caribbean Pollo Saltado (also delicious, rich but complex, Jamaican chicken curry)  The Ropa Vieja (A traditional stewed shredded beef which was very good) and the  Steak Cubano (also very good, my husband ordered rare and it was definitely cooked perfectly)  

We do eat out often in Stamford and love the variety of options, I happened upon this because it is restaurant week it is always a great opportunity to try new places.  That said we did not eat off to he restaurant week menu and opted for the normal menu and we were glad we did.

Location is bizarre as it is above street level in Landmark Square, but parking is super easy as there is an entrance to the Landmark garage literally right below the restaurant. (I never knew it was there) They have outdoor seating which would have been nice but there was a party and we opted for inside.  This is why I gave Cilantro 4 stars.  The service was particularly slow.  half an hour to get a drink and another 20 minutes after we finished our meal to get a check even though we had our leftovers already boxed.  We were just twiddling our thumbs waiting.  I have a feeling it was because of the party, it is certainly worth giving them another shot. and I will reevaluate then.

data.title: Great Food and Good Service
data.text: The place is kind of small but the food and the service was great. The homemade guacamole with plantain chips were delicious. The skirt steak served with black beans and white rice was delicious. You can park in the mall and walk a very short distance to the Restaurant.

data.title: Went because of positive reviews
data.text: Experience lived up to positive reviews. Went on a Friday evening, seated on time with selection of outside patio or inside. Decent crowd at 7:00 PM, full by 8:00 PM. ParkiNg either in mall parking lot or in the Landmark Center pay lot - would recommend the later as the crowd on Atlantic street near mall plaza and parking lot access can be sketchy. Great choice of specialized cocktails, excellent guacamole. Very good red snapper and Gaucho steak. Service excellent. Of note - restaurant not at street level, up one flight of outside stairway. Easy to walk past. For Latin fusion they do it right.

data.title: Great Margaritas, Snapper and Service
data.text: I have been to this restaurant 4 times in the last month.  The drinks were excellent.  Try the jalapeño margaritas, my mouth is watering thinking about it.  The snapper was delicious. The appetizers were all right on, yum.  Not the ordinary choices you see at other similar restaurants in the area.  Thank you to our server Erik for being such a great host on 3 of our visits ~ his margs were THE BEST.  Would recommend this restaurant for drinks, apps or dinner.  Has a great outdoor space above the street.  One of my new favorites in town.  Park in the lot next store, so easy because you can walk up the stairs or use elevator which opens right to the restaurant.

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: Love this place, great food, presentation and the staff is very nice and friendly.  I have been there many times since they opened and can't wait to go back.

data.title: Great First Time Experience
data.text: The food was very good in a contemporary atmosphere. Polite and professional wait staff. We will visit again. I recommend highly.

data.title: Great flavors
data.text: This place is small and cute right next to mall. We shared the short rib appetizers it was delicious. Great flavors. The chicken quesadilla was also good. The cilantro margarita was fresh and good. All reasonable priced. Definitely going back.

data.title: Must try.  Hidden Gem.  Great dining experience.
data.text: We eat out a lot in Stamford.  This relatively new Latino fusion place quickly became one of our favorites.  The food is always fresh, portions are generous and the service is great. It also has a nice vibe and is reasonably priced.. For appetizers, the ceviche mixto and watercrest with avocado salad are standouts. For entrees, try the cazuela (Peruvian seafood stew), camarones al ajo (shrimp) and arroz con pollo.  My family also likes all the steak entrees.  Try everything, you can't go wrong.  We also had a party for 30+ people and it was fabulous.  Service was efficient and the food was as good as always.  Everyone left happy and couldn't stop talking about how great Cilantro is.  It was a pleasure to work with the owner on the event.

data.title: Great food, fresh ingredients
data.text: Had a great Mother's Day lunch. The fried plantains and fresh salsa served before the meal was so good we hardly finished the appetizers we ordered. The portions are large and very flavorful.

data.title: Superb!
data.text:
Love this place. great, Latin style cuisine completed by a cozy location, great service and central location in the heart of downtown Stamford. Menu is dedicated to first rate food instead of a laundry list of choices. Try any of the fish options, I often do when I'm not in the mood for steak or seafood. 
Don't hesitate, just go!

data.title: Excellent Food and Perfect Location
data.text: This has easily become my Husband and I's favorite restaurant in Stamford. The lunch menu offers competitive pricing and delicious options for everyone. Before Cilantro I had never tried many Latin dishes. After Cilantro, I crave them! My favorite menu items are the Pollo Saltado (lunch) and Pollo Relleno (dinner). We highly recommend!

data.title: Great food and location
data.text: Food is excellent, especially before a show at The Palace Theater, which is literally across the street.  As it's located up a flight of stairs, it's easy to pass it by and miss it.  I think the patio/terrace will be a great place to dine in warmer weather.  The happy hour specials (food and drinks) were fantastic, as was the food.  As other posters have mentioned, though, the service is lacking. They clearly need to hire more waitstaff, as it appeared only 2 waitresses were working on a busy Thursday night with all tables occupied. Will definitely go back again.

data.title: Absolutely delicious
data.text: The best latin food in the area. This new kid on the block impresses more than any of the seasoned vets.  Hopefully they make it, they are just in a tough spot, very easy to miss, but don't miss it.

data.title: Try the Enyucado!
data.text:
One word= Amazing. 
Stopped by here for a cocktail and appetizer and couldn't have been more impressed. Eric and Jay along with the rest of the crew were so friendly and hospitable. Go for the guacamole and the (don't forget this) the "Enyucado"! It's light, crispy yuca bread stuffed with short rib topped with a delicate slaw. Yum!
We absolutely loved this place and cannot wait to go back for dinner.

data.title: Dinner before theater.
data.text:
Good news- bad news.  
Good news: the Food is excellent. 
Bad news: service is non existent.   It was so bad, we expected someone to jump out and say: surprise, you are on candid camera! 

Our friends invited us to the concert at the Palace Theatre on Saturday night.  As a thank you we invited them to have pre-theatre dinner at Cilantro, conveniently located across the street from the theatre.  My husband and I walked in at 6:15.  We told the waitress, there will be 4 of us, and we would like a drink before our friends come.  The waitress took my husband's drink order and walked away without taking mine.  
When finally I located her, I asked if i can order some wine. I had to show her on the menu what I wanted, it looked like she didn't understand a word I said.  
At 6:20 our friends arrived and were seated. When we came in, I said that we are going to 8 pm show.  We need to leave restaurant no later then 7:45.  We ordered food at 6:30.  We ordered appetizers and main course.  Again, the waitress smiled and said, ok.   At 6:55 nothing arrived. We called the manager. And suddenly a young men, another waiter, appeared and asked if he can take our order.  We told him, we have ordered half an hour ago. He promised to check on our order.  At 7:05 nothing arrived.  
I told the manager that we don't want main courses, no time.  Just bring us our appetizers.  At 740 two soups with  empanadas arrived.  And my husband got his saviche.  At the same time the fourth  person received his entree.  We ordered guacamole, never got it.  
I had ask someone else to get us our wine.  
Mind u, the restaurant was full.  People were coming and going, all promptly seated and served.  Our table and a table next to us had nothing.  The manager apologized and said, so sorry, your drinks are on the house.
It was embarrassing and upsetting.   
We rushed to eat our food and left.   Don't get me wrong, the food at Cilantro is excellent.  We just got a waitress that was either first day on the job or was the owner's niece or girlfriend.  She could hardly speak English.  And from what  I observed, could hardly understand it.  

It is a new restaurant. However, opening a downtown location and competing with a lot of restaurants nearby requires a certain level of service and a certain level of personnel.   

My husband and I felt utterly embarrassed in front of the friends.

data.title: Great Latino Fusion
data.text: An outstanding Latin fusion restaurant.  Cerviche, papoosa, empanada were all excellent.  Service was attentive and also very good.  This is one of the better restaurants in Stamford.

data.title: Delicious, and Amazing Service
data.text: We were part of a group of guests at a party held at Cilantro. Although there was a mix-up about where we were seated, and ended up outdoors in November, all went well and it was a wonderful lunch. We were a fairly large group with people milling about, yet the wait staff got every order right and found each of us, even if we'd moved to a different spot. Cannot say enough about the professionalism of the staff, and cannot say enough about how delicious everything was. We had chips and salsa, empanadas, guacamole, and calamari as big group appetizers, and each person ordered individually for his/her entree. Every single one was totally, well, delicious. Cuban sandwich, chicken and rice, steak, quesadillas - every person raved about how good the food was. I have never been a sangria fan, but there were pitchers provided and it was excellent. We look forward to returning another time. The restaurant is up a big flight of stairs from Atlantic Street, but there is an elevator somewhere in the back that can accommodate those with walking/stair climbing disabilities.
